problems.title: Meeting Rooms I
problems.description: Given an array of meeting time intervals where intervals[i] = [starti, endi], determine if a person could attend all meetings.

steps: Sort intervals by start time
Check if any two consecutive intervals overlap
Return false if overlap found, true otherwise

examples.explanation: Cannot attend all meetings because [0,30] overlaps with [5,10] and [15,20]
No overlapping meetings, can attend all

problems.title: Minimum Size Subarray Sum
problems.description: Given an array of positive integers nums and a positive integer target, return the minimal length of a subarray whose sum is greater than or equal to target.

steps: Use two pointers (left, right) for sliding window
Expand window by moving right pointer
When sum >= target, try to shrink from left
Track minimum window size found

examples.explanation: Subarray [4,3] has minimal length and sum >= 7

problems.title: Find All Anagrams
problems.description: Given two strings s and p, return an array of all the start indices of p's anagrams in s.

steps: Create frequency map for pattern p
Use sliding window of size p.length() on string s
Compare character frequencies in current window
Add start index when frequencies match

examples.explanation: Anagrams of "ab" start at indices 0 and 2
Only one anagram found at index 0

problems.title: Longest Substring Without Repeating
problems.description: Given a string s, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.

steps: Use two pointers for sliding window
Expand window by moving right pointer
When duplicate found, shrink from left until no duplicates
Track maximum window size

examples.explanation: "abc" is the longest substring without repeating characters
"b" is the longest substring without repeating characters

problems.title: Serialize and Deserialize Binary Tree
problems.topic: String, Tree, DFS, BFS, Binary Tree
problems.description: Design an algorithm to serialize and deserialize a binary tree. Serialization is converting a tree to a string. Deserialization is constructing the tree from the string.

steps: Serialize: Use preorder traversal, mark nulls with special character
Deserialize: Parse string and reconstruct using preorder
Use queue/index to track position during reconstruction

problems.title: Reverse Nodes in k-Group
problems.description: Given the head of a linked list, reverse the nodes of the list k at a time, and return the modified list.

steps: Check if we have k nodes to reverse
Reverse k nodes using standard reversal technique
Connect reversed group to previous and next parts
Move to next group

problems.title: Number of Islands
problems.description: Given an m x n 2D binary grid which represents a map of '1's (land) and '0's (water), return the number of islands.

steps: Iterate through each cell in the grid
When land ('1') is found, increment island count
Use DFS/BFS to mark all connected land as visited
Continue until all cells are processed

problems.title: Word Ladder
problems.description: Given two words, beginWord and endWord, and a dictionary wordList, return the length of the shortest transformation sequence from beginWord to endWord.

steps: Use BFS to find shortest path
For each word, try changing each character
Check if new word exists in dictionary
Continue until endWord is found

problems.title: Edit Distance
problems.description: Given two strings word1 and word2, return the minimum number of operations required to convert word1 to word2.

steps: Create DP table dp[i][j] for first i chars of word1, first j chars of word2
If characters match, dp[i][j] = dp[i-1][j-1]
Otherwise, take min of insert, delete, replace operations
Return dp[m][n]

problems.title: LRU Cache
problems.description: Design a data structure that follows the constraints of a Least Recently Used (LRU) cache.

steps: Use HashMap for O(1) access to nodes
Use doubly linked list to maintain order
Move accessed nodes to head
Remove tail when capacity exceeded

examples.input: LRUCache(2); put(1,1); put(2,2); get(1); put(3,3); get(2); put(4,4); get(1); get(3); get(4)

problems.title: Merge Intervals
problems.description: Given an array of intervals where intervals[i] = [starti, endi], merge all overlapping intervals.

steps: Sort intervals by start time
Iterate and merge overlapping intervals
Update end time when overlapping
Add non-overlapping intervals to result

problems.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
problems.description: You are given an array prices where prices[i] is the price of a given stock on the ith day. You want to maximize your profit by choosing a single day to buy one stock and choosing a different day in the future to sell that stock.

steps: Track minimum price seen so far
For each price, calculate profit if sold today
Update maximum profit found
Update minimum price

examples.explanation: Buy on day 2 (price = 1) and sell on day 5 (price = 6), profit = 6-1 = 5

problems.title: Group Anagrams
problems.description: Given an array of strings strs, group the anagrams together.

algorithm.approach: Hash Map with Sorted String Key
steps: For each string, sort characters to create key
Group strings with same sorted key
Return all groups as result

problems.title: K Closest Points to Origin
problems.topic: Array, Math, Divide and Conquer, Geometry, Sorting, Heap
problems.description: Given an array of points where points[i] = [xi, yi] represents a point on the X-Y plane and an integer k, return the k closest points to the origin (0, 0).

steps: Calculate distance for each point
Use priority queue to maintain k closest points
Return the k points with smallest distances

problems.title: Meeting Rooms II
problems.topic: Array, Two Pointers, Greedy, Sorting, Heap
problems.description: Given an array of meeting time intervals intervals where intervals[i] = [starti, endi], return the minimum number of conference rooms required.

steps: Sort meetings by start time
Use min heap to track end times of ongoing meetings
For each meeting, remove ended meetings from heap
Add current meeting's end time to heap
Max heap size is the answer

examples.explanation: Need 2 rooms: one for [0,30], another for [5,10] and [15,20]

problems.title: Merge k Sorted Lists
problems.topic: Linked List, Divide and Conquer, Heap, Merge Sort
problems.description: You are given an array of k linked-lists lists, each linked-list is sorted in ascending order. Merge all the linked-lists into one sorted linked-list and return it.

steps: Use min heap to track current head of each list
Extract minimum node and add to result
Add next node from same list to heap
Continue until all lists are processed

examples.explanation: Merge all sorted lists into one

problems.title: Trapping Rain Water
problems.topic: Array, Two Pointers, Dynamic Programming, Stack, Monotonic Stack
problems.description: Given n non-negative integers representing an elevation map where the width of each bar is 1, compute how much water it can trap after raining.

steps: Use two pointers from both ends
Track max height seen from left and right
Water level at position = min(leftMax, rightMax) - height
Move pointer with smaller max height

problems.title: 3Sum
problems.description: Given an integer array nums, return all the triplets [nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]] such that i != j, i != k, and j != k, and nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0.

steps: Sort the array first
Fix first element, use two pointers for remaining two
Skip duplicates to avoid duplicate triplets
Adjust pointers based on sum comparison with target

examples.explanation: All unique triplets that sum to 0

problems.title: Valid Parentheses
problems.description: Given a string s containing just the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.

steps: Use stack to track opening brackets
For each closing bracket, check if it matches top of stack
Return true if stack is empty at the end

problems.title: Add Two Numbers
problems.description: You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. The digits are stored in reverse order, and each of their nodes contains a single digit. Add the two numbers and return the sum as a linked list.

steps: Traverse both lists simultaneously
Add corresponding digits plus carry
Create new node with sum % 10
Update carry = sum / 10
Handle remaining digits and final carry

problems.title: Word Search
problems.description: Given an m x n grid of characters board and a string word, return true if word exists in the grid.

steps: Try starting from each cell in the grid
Use DFS to explore all 4 directions
Mark visited cells temporarily
Backtrack by unmarking cells after exploring

problems.title: Maximum Subarray
problems.topic: Array, Divide and Conquer, Dynamic Programming
problems.description: Given an integer array nums, find the subarray with the largest sum, and return its sum.

steps: Track current sum and maximum sum
For each element, decide to extend current subarray or start new
Current sum = max(current element, current sum + current element)
Update maximum sum found so far

problems.title: Search Suggestions System
problems.description: You are given an array of strings products and a string searchWord. Design a system that suggests at most three product names from products after each character of searchWord is typed.

steps: Sort products array
For each prefix, find first matching product using binary search
Collect up to 3 products starting from that position
Filter products that don't match current prefix

problems.title: Median of Two Sorted Arrays
problems.topic: Array, Binary Search, Divide and Conquer
problems.description: Given two sorted arrays nums1 and nums2 of size m and n respectively, return the median of the two sorted arrays.

steps: Ensure nums1 is the smaller array
Binary search on nums1 to find correct partition
Partition such that left half has (m+n+1)/2 elements
Check if partition is valid and calculate median

problems.title: Keys and Rooms
problems.description: There are n rooms labeled from 0 to n - 1 and all the rooms are locked except for room 0. Your goal is to visit all the rooms.

steps: Start from room 0 (unlocked)
Use DFS/BFS to visit reachable rooms
Collect keys from visited rooms
Check if all rooms are visited

examples.explanation: Start in room 0, get key 1, go to room 1, get key 2, etc.

problems.title: Nearest Smaller Element (Monotonic Stack)
problems.description: For each element in the array, find the nearest smaller element to its left. If none, return -1 for that position.

steps: Iterate through array from left to right
Use stack to keep track of indices of elements in increasing order
For each element, pop from stack until top is smaller or stack is empty
Nearest smaller is stack top or -1 if stack is empty

problems.title: Shortest Safe Path (Matrix BFS)
problems.description: Given a matrix with safe (1) and unsafe (0) cells, find the shortest path from any cell in the first column to any cell in the last column, moving only through safe cells.

algorithm.approach: BFS from All First Column Safe Cells
steps: For each safe cell in the first column, start BFS
Track visited cells to avoid cycles
For each move, only go to safe, unvisited cells
Return minimum path length to any last column cell

examples.explanation: Shortest safe path from first to last column is length 3

problems.title: Maximize Equal-Cost Packages (Greedy)
problems.description: Given an array of package costs, split them into two groups with equal total cost. Return the maximum number of packages in either group. If not possible, return -1.

steps: Calculate total sum, if odd return -1
Use DP to check if subset sum = total/2 is possible
Track max number of packages in such a subset

examples.explanation: Split into [11] and [1,5,5], both sum to 11, max group size is 2

problems.title: Checksum Distinct Values (Hash Set)
problems.description: Given an array of integers, return the sum of all distinct values.

steps: Insert all elements into a set
Sum all elements in the set

problems.title: Minimum Window Substring
problems.description: Given two strings s and t, return the minimum window in s which contains all the characters of t. If no such window exists, return the empty string.

steps: Count frequency of each character in t
Expand window by moving right pointer, include characters
When all required characters are included, try to shrink from left
Track minimum window length and position

examples.explanation: Smallest window containing A, B, C is 'BANC'

problems.title: Find Peak Element
problems.description: A peak element is an element that is strictly greater than its neighbors. Given an integer array nums, find a peak element and return its index.

steps: Use binary search to find a peak
Compare middle element with neighbors
Move to side with greater neighbor
Return index when peak is found

examples.explanation: Element at index 2 (3) is a peak

problems.title: Subarray Sum Equals K
problems.description: Given an array of integers nums and an integer k, return the total number of continuous subarrays whose sum equals to k.

steps: Use hash map to store prefix sum counts
Iterate through array, update prefix sum
For each prefix sum, check if (sum - k) exists in map
Increment result by count of (sum - k)

examples.explanation: Two subarrays sum to 2: [1,1] at positions 0-1 and 1-2

problems.title: Course Schedule
problems.description: There are a total of numCourses courses you have to take, labeled from 0 to numCourses-1. Some courses have prerequisites. Return true if you can finish all courses.

steps: Build graph and in-degree array from prerequisites
Add all nodes with in-degree 0 to queue
Process queue, decrement in-degree of neighbors
If all courses processed, return true

examples.explanation: Can finish all courses by taking 0 then 1

problems.title: Search in Rotated Sorted Array
problems.description: Given the array nums after the rotation and an integer target, return the index of target if it is in nums, or -1 if it is not in nums.

steps: Use binary search, check which half is sorted
If left half is sorted and target in range, search left
Else search right half
Repeat until found or search space is empty

problems.title: Combination Sum
problems.description: Given an array of distinct integers candidates and a target integer target, return a list of all unique combinations of candidates where the chosen numbers sum to target.

steps: Sort candidates for pruning
Use backtracking to try each candidate
If sum exceeds target, backtrack
If sum equals target, add combination to result

examples.explanation: All unique combinations that sum to 7

problems.title: Insert Interval
problems.description: Given a set of non-overlapping intervals, insert a new interval into the intervals (merge if necessary).

steps: Add all intervals before new interval
Merge overlapping intervals with new interval
Add remaining intervals after new interval

problems.title: Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array
problems.description: Suppose an array of length n sorted in ascending order is rotated between 1 and n times. Find the minimum element.

steps: Use binary search to find inflection point
If mid element > right, min is in right half
Else min is in left half
Return the minimum found

problems.title: Clone Graph
problems.description: Given a reference of a node in a connected undirected graph, return a deep copy (clone) of the graph.

steps: Use a hash map to store cloned nodes
For each node, recursively clone neighbors
Return the cloned node for each original node

examples.explanation: Graph is cloned with same structure

problems.title: Product of Array Except Self
problems.description: Given an integer array nums, return an array answer such that answer[i] is equal to the product of all the elements of nums except nums[i].

steps: Compute prefix products for each index
Compute suffix products for each index
Multiply prefix and suffix for each index to get result

examples.explanation: Product except self for each index

problems.title: Spiral Matrix
problems.description: Given an m x n matrix, return all elements of the matrix in spiral order.

steps: Define boundaries for top, bottom, left, right
Traverse each layer in spiral order
Shrink boundaries after each layer

problems.title: Set Matrix Zeroes
problems.description: Given an m x n integer matrix, if an element is 0, set its entire row and column to 0 in-place.

algorithm.approach: Use First Row and Column as Markers
steps: Check if first row and column need to be zeroed
Use first row and column to mark zero rows/columns
Zero out marked rows and columns
Zero first row/column if needed

examples.explanation: Row 1 and column 1 set to zero
